query

Class EventInXMLfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • query.EventInXMLfile

  • public class EventInXMLfile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an event described in a user query (send via a XMLfile).
    Author:
    cossin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventInXMLfile(org.w3c.dom.Node eventNode)
      Transform a XML element describing an event to an instance of this class : check if the event type is in the EventOntology check if all predicates are known check values of predicates are correct (date, numeric values or instance of a terminology) Transform the description into SPARQL statements

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventInXMLfile

        public EventInXMLfile(org.w3c.dom.Node eventNode)
               throws UnfoundEventException,
                      InvalidXMLFormat,
                      UnfoundPredicatException,
                      java.text.ParseException,
                      UnfoundTerminologyException
        Transform a XML element describing an event to an instance of this class :
        • check if the event type is in the EventOntology
        • check if all predicates are known
        • check values of predicates are correct (date, numeric values or instance of a terminology)
        • Transform the description into SPARQL statements
        Parameters:
        eventNode - A XML element describing an event. See XMLFile
        Throws:
        UnfoundEventException - If the event type is not in the EventOntology
        InvalidXMLFormat - If XML element is invalid (already checked normally)
        UnfoundPredicatException - If a predicate of this event is not in the EventOntology
        java.text.ParseException
        UnfoundTerminologyException - The terminology is not found in the EventOntology

    • Method Detail

                                   UnfoundPredicatException,
                                   java.text.ParseException,
                                   UnfoundTerminologyException
        Extract from the XML element the predicates and create SPARQL statements
        Parameters:
        eventNode - A XML element describing an event. See XMLFile
        Throws:
        InvalidXMLFormat - If XML element is invalid (already checked normally)
        UnfoundPredicatException - If a predicate of this event is not in the EventOntology
        java.text.ParseException
        UnfoundTerminologyException - The terminology is not found in the EventOntology

      • addLinkStatement

        public void addLinkStatement(org.eclipse.rdf4j.model.IRI predicate)
                      throws UnfoundPredicatException
        If there is a link between 2 events, we must add the description before comparison.
        Ex : link between hasEnd and hasBeginning of events 0 and 1 ; we add hasEnd statement of event0 and hasBeginning of event1 before comparison of dates.
        Parameters:
        predicate -
        Throws:
        UnfoundPredicatException

      • getVariableName

        public java.lang.String getVariableName(java.lang.String predicateName)
        Variable names are created by concatenation of the eventVariable (ex : ?event0) and localName of predicate (ex : hasBeginning). (ex : ?event0hasBeginning)
        Parameters:
        predicateName -
        Returns:

      • getNumericFilter

        public static java.lang.String getNumericFilter(java.lang.String numericVariableName,
                                                java.lang.String minValue,
                                                java.lang.String maxValue)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get a SPARQL statement for filtering a numeric value
        Parameters:
        numericVariableName - The name of the numeric variable
        minValue - The minimum value for this variable
        maxValue - The maximum value for this variable
        Returns:
        A string for a filter statement
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
